project_abstract.cdata: The Inner Mongolia Highway Project aims at improving the efficiency, safety, and cost-effectiveness of the transport infrastructure, to support the development of the Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, by improving accessibility to its poorer areas, and reducing the region's socioeconomic disparity. The main components include: 1) construction of the Laoyemiao-Jining highway (LJH) - a divided four-lane, access controlled toll highway - which as part of the national highway network, and critical within the east-west corridor in the region, will connect the key industrial, administrative, and hub cities of Baotou, Hohhot, and Jining. Supply of equipment, electrical installation, lighting systems, and construction supervision will be financed, based on environmental criteria established prior to commencement of civil works; 2) a highway network improvement program for poverty areas, establishing that sections to be constructed should link the poor to the developed areas in the province, based on established monitoring and performance indicators; 3) highway safety program, as per detailed engineering designs, that include installation of traffic safety facilities; and, 4) institutional strengthening, and training, enhanced through technical assistance provision for project preparation, road maintenance programs, and engineering research.

P070459.projectinfo: <![CDATA[<Project><LangCode>ZH</LangCode><ProjectName>内蒙古公路项目</ProjectName><ProjectAbstract>项目的主要内容包括：1、建设从老爷庙到吉宁的四车道收费公路，该公路为国道主干线的组成部分，也是区内东西交通走廊的重要组成部分，连接着包头、呼和浩特、吉宁等主要工业、行政和枢纽城市。2、贫困地区的路网改造，新建路段将把贫困地区和发达地区连接起来。3、公路交通安全计划，包括安装交通安全设施。4、通过项目准备、公路养护计划和工程技术研究等工作加强机构建设和培训。</ProjectAbstract></Project>]]>
